discussion.content: A. Looking for sensitive info using Macie

Selected Answer: A
Amazon Macie is a fully managed data security and data privacy service
that uses machine learning and pattern matching to discover and
protect your sensitive data in AWS.

Macie helps identify and alert you to sensitive data, such as personally
identifiable information (PII)
Anmswer is A - Amazon Macie is a fully managed data security and data privacy service that uses machine learning and pattern matching to discover and protect your sensitive data in AWS.

questions.question_text:
A company is creating an application that will keep records. The application will run on Amazon EC2 instances and will use an Amazon Aurora MySQL database as its data store. To maintain compliance, the application must not retain information that is determined to be sensitive.
Which technique should a SysOps administrator use to detect if sensitive data is being stored in the application?

choices.B: Install the Amazon GuardDuty plugin for Aurora. Configure GuardDuty to examine the database. Add the corresponding EC2 CIDR ranges to the trusted IP list in GuardDuty. Examine the report for any sensitive data that is discovered.
choices.A: Export data from the database by using an AWS Lambda function. Store the data in Amazon S3. Use Amazon Macie to examine the stored data. Examine the report for any sensitive data that is discovered.
choices.C: Deploy Amazon Inspector by installing the Amazon Inspector agent on all EC2 instances. Set the Amazon Inspector assessment type to HOST assessment. Include NETWORK communications with the Aurora DB cluster. Examine the report for any sensitive data that is discovered.
choices.D: Use VPC Flow Logs to examine traffic between the EC2 instances and the Aurora DB cluster. Store the log files in Amazon S3. Use Amazon Detective to examine the extracted log files. Examine the report for any sensitive data that is discovered.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A VPC interface endpoint allows you to privately connect your VPC to supported AWS services without requiring an internet gateway, NAT instance, or VPN connection. With a VPC interface endpoint for AWS KMS, the SysOps administrator can securely access the AWS KMS service within the VPC without the need for internet connectivity.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kms/latest/developerguide/kms-vpc-endpoint.html
D
thanks haim

D.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kms/latest/developerguide/kms-vpc-endpoint.html
Answer: D
Answer: D
Answer is D
D, VPC interface endpoint is the way to go

questions.question_text:
A SysOps administrator needs a secure way to connect to AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) within a VPC. The SysOps administrator must ensure that connections to AWS KMS do not traverse the internet.
What is the MOST secure solution that meets these requirements?

choices.C: Use a VPC gateway endpoint for Amazon S3 to connect to AWS KMS.
choices.D: Use a VPC interface endpoint to connect to AWS KMS.
choices.A: Use a bastion host to connect to AWS KMS.
choices.B: Use a NAT gateway to connect to AWS KMS.

discussion.content:
Answer: C
Service catalog is the way to go

Selected Answer: C
AWS Service Catalog allows you to create and manage catalogs of IT services that are approved for use on AWS. To implement the requirement, a SysOps administrator can create a product in AWS Service Catalog that represents the approved EC2 instance configurations. This product will define the allowed configurations for EC2 instances. Additionally, a launch constraint role can be defined and associated with this product to control the permissions that the business units have while launching instances.

By following this approach, the business units will be able to provision EC2 instances only through AWS Service Catalog using the approved configurations defined in the product. This ensures that all EC2 instances launched by the business units adhere to the company's standards and approved configurations.
I'll go for C

questions.question_text:
A company has several business units that want to use Amazon EC2. The company wants to require all business units to provision their EC2 instances by using only approved EC2 instance configurations.
What should a SysOps administrator do to implement this requirement?

choices.A: Create an EC2 instance launch configuration. Allow the business units to launch EC2 instances by specifying this launch configuration in the AWS Management Console.
choices.B: Develop an IAM policy that limits the business units to provision EC2 instances only. Instruct the business units to launch instances by using an AWS CloudFormation template.
choices.D: Share an AWS CloudFormation template with the business units. Instruct the business units to pass a role to AWS CloudFormation to allow the service to manage EC2 instances.
choices.C: Publish a product and launch constraint role for EC2 instances by using AWS Service Catalog. Allow the business units to perform actions in AWS Service Catalog only.

three AZ and two capacity?

B

B.
You have an ELB configured and you need two EC2 (des\min\max =2)
 if one AZ fail the Auto scale will launch new instance in 3'rd AZ.
Answer is B

Answer is A
Highly available --> 2 AZs
Without a load balancer, it becomes an issue if you bring up 2 instances across 2 AZs. Hence A is the best option.

comments.content: I saw LB configured correctly.. Hence changing my answer to B

discussion.content: I choose B

choices.A: Create an Auto Scaling group by using the launch configuration across at least two Availability Zones. Configure a minimum capacity of 1, a desired capacity of 1, and a maximum capacity of 1.
choices.C: Create an Auto Scaling group by using the launch configuration across at least two AWS Regions. Configure a minimum capacity of 1, a desired capacity of 1, and a maximum capacity of 1.
choices.B: Create an Auto Scaling group by using the launch configuration across at least three Availability Zones. Configure a minimum capacity of 2, a desired capacity of 2, and a maximum capacity of 2.
choices.D: Create an Auto Scaling group by using the launch configuration across at least three AWS Regions. Configure a minimum capacity of 2, a desired capacity of 2, and a maximum capacity of 2.

questions.question_text:
A company has an application that is running on an Amazon EC2 instance in one Availability Zone. A SysOps administrator needs to make the application highly available. The SysOps administrator has created a launch configuration from the running EC2 instance. The SysOps administrator also has properly configured a load balancer.
What should the SysOps administrator do next to make the application highly available?

discussion.content:
VPC ENDPOINT
A

A is the answer. Route traffic to and from the AWS resource through the gateway VPC endpoint, rather than through the NAT gateway. There's no data processing or hourly charges for using gateway VPC endpoints.
answer is A

choices.B: Write an S3 bucket policy to enforce encryption in transit for the uploads.
choices.A: Configure and use a VPC endpoint.
choices.D: Disable cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) for the S3 bucket.
choices.C: Configure the S3 bucket to use the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class.

questions.question_text:
A SysOps administrator is testing a new batch job. The batch job will upload 20 GB of data from Amazon EC2 instances in a private subnet to an Amazon S3 bucket each day. After the first test is complete, a small cost is reported. The cost has the heading `NAT Gateway - Data Processed.`
Which change can the SysOps administrator make to eliminate this cost for future tests?
